title: Please add an "invisible" option when logging in.
body:
Sometimes you just want to play alone.


Edit:

Here is a scenario for you:

Say you just left for college and your 14yr old Mama's boy little brother keeps asking you to play. So you want to log in to play a few to relax, alone, but your brother sees you on. He asks you to play, but you say no you want to play alone. Now he runs to mom and she is now blowing up your phone saying "Why are you being mean to your little brother, just play with him, he misses you." Now your relaxing just got wrecked by having to carry little bro, or losing. If you log off, mom is going to call you and say you just logged off to avoid him and you should be a better big brother. 

Wouldn't you of wanted to just log in invis and play a couple alone?

replies.body: Tryndamere always plays alone.
{{champion:32}} wants friends but has none {{item:3070}}

Upvoted because I always get this problem. I want to play some ranked to try to climb a bit but suddenly my friend who literally has an average of about 40 cs in 40 minutes wants to play... The worst part is I know them irl so if I ignore them or tell them "I don't want to play with you right now" they end up complaining to me the next day. I would seriously love to see an option to be invisible. There's nothing wrong with it. People who want to use it will use it and people who don't, well... they don't. 

It just saves people from being forced to explain WHY DIDNT YOU PLAY WITH ME

> [{quoted}](name=Solemdeath,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=9B5EXkaq,comment-id=000d,timestamp=2016-10-25T01:28:13.109+0000)

> It just saves people from being forced to explain WHY DIDNT YOU PLAY WITH ME

THIS. I had a guy on my friends list who didn't understand why he wasn't climbing. I told him I was only queuing solo in ranked for the time being and he had a melt down saying "Oh it's cause I suck, thanks man. Thanks a lot".. I ended up queuing with him, winning one, then in the proceeding 2 games he fed his ass off making the same mistake over and over. I ended up blocking/deleting him just to ensure I wouldn't have to deal with him again. If we had invisible mode I could have turned that on for queuing ranked and turned it off for the few norms I usually play.

"WHY WON'T YOU PLAY WITH ME???" 

BECAUSE YOU DON'T LEARN!

Lol it feels so bad. I add people I have fun with in norms all the time, and all of a sudden they see me queing up for a ranked match and are like "hey! ranked?!" and it's like uhhhhhhhhh.... no, sorry? Being Plat and having silvers yell at you saying that you aren't that much better than them, and that you're a jerk for not playing with them, feels really bad. Your only option is to literally tell them you don't think they're good enough. Thankfully RIOT made it so players two leagues apart can no longer queue together. Now I just have to deal with the massive amount of Gold V players on my friends list.

P.S. - WHY ARE THERE SO MANY GOLD V PLAYERS??
Also allow us to turn off friend of a friend queuing for online friends
Please this. You have available and away but not invisible. Sometimes I just want to play alone or with a specific friend, but I can't do that when I get spammed.
To me it's always the IRL friend that blows me up. The guy I have to see at work the next day and I have to dodge around the fact that I played with my other friends and not him.

Exactly this. And a lot of my IRL friends are... bad. Sometimes I don't want to have to go tryhard and carry in norms, I just want to play something fun but still have a shot at winning. And I can't.. y'know, say that to an irl friend.
Just tell them that, it isn't exactly hard.

Then you get the whole 'wtf why is it cuz im bad?' thing. Also if you know them in real life, it's hard to explain you want to play and you want to play with friends, just not them specifically. Plus it's not like adding an invisible feature hurts anyway, it'd only do good for those who want it and for those who don't care they shouldn't care.

Like I said maybe they're just assholes. (different post sorry)

For years on and offline I just tell people I'm going into chill mode and they leave it at that, some will message me after to see if I'm want to play with them still and if I do I will. If I'm playing with another group I'll just say I'm playing with these guys for now maybe later. 

From times I'll even try to get them to join the group i'm currently in if we have space.

I grew up with a large family and through them I made quite literally a hundred friends. I know how to manage my time with them. If people can't take the fact that there are others then themselves in the world then they need to fuck off.

I actually upvoted you, but only to cancel out the downvote. Anyway not everyone is that understanding. Asshole isn't really the right word. Some people have low self esteem and would take that to mean you don't like them or something. Some people are clingy. Etc. They'd understand if I explained it to them, albeit perhaps a bit sad, but I don't really want to even explain it. It'd be easier to have an invis mode. Like they already have an "away/busy" mode so it's not adding much work at all.

assuming that your friends are ACTUALLY friends ( not some random ppl you know irl but barely every talk to) its hard to just go up and say " you are kinda bad at league and i dont want to play with you that much." you can try to help your friend at getting better but sometimes its better to keep the other persons feelings in mind when talking with them.
but that would take basic social skills

I know right. People in this thread are wanting a cop out of a situation that shouldn't be avoided. 

If you're tired you tell people your tired.

If you'r hungry you tell people you're hungry.

If you want to have some "Me" time then you tell them that.

No need to over complicate it.
Whoa, we got a Mr. Popular over here.
Not really. There's like.. 6 people I play with consistently. You can be spammed even by only one person
can i b friendz?

Tbh one of my friends is like level 11 and makes me play with him. I get such shitty teammates when I do though because it averages our MMR. I don't really wanna play with people under level 30 unless I have to haha.

> [{quoted}](name=Revan Senpai,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=9B5EXkaq,comment-id=00020000000000000000,timestamp=2016-10-24T22:55:17.560+0000)
>
> Tbh one of my friends is like level 11 and makes me play with him. I get such shitty teammates when I do though because it averages our MMR. I don't really wanna play with people under level 30 unless I have to haha.

I had a friend like this, I tried explaining to him that it was a bad idea but he insisted we play together. I decided to only play jungle with him and never gank, he fed a ton and I told him "That's just what happens when you play with higher level players." Kind of a jerk move on my part, but it got him more motivated to get better, so win-win in my book.
I like that you wouldn't gank. Too many people don't learn how to play solo and get carried, and expect it to be that way when they're 30
Wow. Rood. I'm actually really good at League of Legends.

Just saying. No. You're not "actually really good". It takes years to understand this game and its mechanics to start playing it on a higher level. Most people who play the game will never get out of bronze. Maybe your first season yea cuz they give you a freebee silver ranking if you win a few promos but silver 4 is average. Not trying to be a bitch but its true. Unless you're korean it'll take you several years AFTER you hit lvl 30 to git gud. I know people who have been playing longer than i have and STILL havent hit gold. Its a long road. Dont fool yourself. Besides ranks increase with experience. People usually dont start hitting gold and plat till they have been playing for 4+ years. Just fact

A) "Good" is extremely objective.
B) You've never even seen me play.

It's pretty bad to blindly hold beliefs about something that you literally know nothing about.

You know people can look up your match history and stuff, right?
Also, unless you're a smurf, it'll almost certainly take a while after reaching level 30 to become even pretty good at the game.

I'm not saying you are bad or anything as I'm not going to bother looking stuff up about you, but it's foolish to assume others don't know anything about you.  It's not very difficult to determine how good a player is.

And he made no actually representation of myself. Just general statements of "you're not 30 so you can't even possibly be good"...whatever "good" is to him. Nor would a smurf account be an end all be all to judge a players skill. I've met a couple people that smurf. They suck because they play silly shit just to goof around.

btw you don't have to downvote people whenever you disagree with them.

I generally just do it if the person is either stubbornly insisting something that is incorrect (and I'm talking facts, not opinions), or they're being extremely rude/trollish/stupid.

I didn't down vote you because I disagreed with you. I down voted because your comment didn't apply to the situation. He made generalizations that I was not "good" (still subjective) based in the fact that I was 30. You then said I'm foolish to think he doesn't know anything about me, when he made it clear that he didn't.

Or just ignore people. Not hard.

Edit: Alot of you need to grow some balls and need to learn how to tell people to fuck off lmao.
Well when you don't want to get spam invited and have people call you and message you in game, ignoring doesn't stop that.

It also doesn't help when you know some of the people trying to invite you in person, either. Good luck dodging around that issue before they just go ahead and take a jackhammer to break that ice. Sometimes it's nice to not let friends know I'm on so I can do some mindless games for my own relaxation without anyone knowing I was there. 

For some reason, some of the people on League are the only people I've seen that actually put up a defensive barrier around not having that feature. Everything else I use has that functionality, just not League.
You can /mute people who whine at you.  You can also block phone numbers.  man up.
Yes, if referring to my example, blocking your mom's number seems very plausible.
Now I'm angry at a little brother I don't have. I need this NOW
I see this comment surface every once in a while. Why are you so insecure that you can't just tell people you want to play solo?
I mean, why should I even have too. What if I want to play with Friend A without upsetting Friend B for something virtually everything with a contacts list has.

Imagine you're out at lunch with Friend A and Friend B sees you guys at the table, they walk up and ask to join you, what do you do now?
Are you gonna hide irl too? Just let your friends know, it's not as bad as you think.

Okay, did you tell Friend B that you weren't going to lunch that day, you were home sick and now Friend B saw you? It's not this complicated, Skype has an invisible option, and plenty of people use it. Are they just as wrong as me?

That's not even the same scenario?
If you're lying to your friends **ahead of time** then logging in and playing while they think you're not playing you deserve some backlash.
If you're not lying to them ahead of time then you have the same scenario I outlined above. 

It's not that hard man.

It's also worth noting that Skype is a platform that has business applications, whereas League is not. That's why Skype has options like that, they're not for hiding from your "friends".
Just tell your friends that. If they can't understand then perhaps they're just assholes.

So here is the problem with that. Say:

Jim from work sees you online asks you to play a few, and you're like nah man I just want to play a couple by myself.
 
Then you go to work tomorrow and Jimmy is like, "yeah I went to spectate Bob's game and saw you were queue'd up with him. WTF man" 

And you have to dodge around saying that you didn't want to have to carry Jimmy. 

Instead you could have just logged in invis, told Bob to do the same and played without Jimmy knowing. 

In every client that has invis, doesn't mean you can't message the people you want to know you are online without offending the people that you don't want to know.

How about instead of lying you tell them the truth. I've had this happen before and usually the situation is. "When I got in the mood to play this other guy set me an invite and I joined. You we're busy or in a game during this time I I left you to your own time."

I typically make it up to them and we're good.

If someone is bad and I don't want to play with them  I tell them "The people I'm playing with wouldn't appreciate your skill." or "I want to play with people my level." I don't play with any of the people in my club because of that same reason. I'm a better player then them and they are aware of this.


on one ever gets offended and I've been doing this for nearly two decades now. The amount of people who get upset about these kinds of moments typically are universally hated people with all of my other friends, they just didn't say anything because they felt I'd get insulted for them making fun on my friends.
So I see your point still seems like avoidable conflict with the simple option of not having to log into chat

That's the most cringy scenario I have ever heard! Just turn off your phone and/or remove your whiny brother from your friends list.

For me, I sometimes just want to check the store, verifying some mods, updating the itemsets, anything other than actually playing, and wanting to be allowed to do that without having 3 notifications of either messages or game invites popping up if I'm logged on for than a minute.

Steam has this. Battle.net has this. Any respectable game has this. Just not this game. Says something about it...

To those having Alpha client access: is this feature either already implemented or confirmed that it will be added there?
I do not believe it is in the current build of the alpha. I also have not checked many of the changes they plan to make to it.

I just ignore anyone that I don't want to play with at any given time.  None of my friends get mad if I click no or if I don't respond.  We're all adults though. So nobody cares if someone wants to play on their own.
But the community is not all adults tho, I couldn't imagine what grill players go through.

There are lots of other reason people would like this option. And there really is NO REASON to be against it.

As to your friends, that's kind of an immature analysis. Fact is, friends ask you to do something with them only so many times, before they stop asking you, so being able to regulate when you are and are not seen, is simply a rational way of managing your friendships.
